intro: Zeuxine pingtungensis, commonly known as the Pingtung zeuxine, is a flowering plant species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has a slender, herbaceous stem with alternate leaves that are usually lanceolate in shape. Zeuxine pingtungensis prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
